I love sweet potatoes but drinking them wasn't so appealing to me, it was quite weird! They have a wide range of other hot drinks such as caramel milk tea. So some new things to try!

Staff were friendly and weren't pushing people out as soon as they finished their drinks.
author: Stephanie O.

description:
Cute little cafe which reminds me of cafes back in HK.

Price:
Definitely a bit steep. Very comparable to your local starbucks. 
~$4 for Drinks
~$7 for Dessert (Cake slices)

Food:
I had a iced vanilla latte which was meh. Nothing too special. Same with my friend's Iced mocha. It was strange that they gave us to go cups when we told them we were dining in, as I ordered a slice of cake as well. 
A slice of tiramisu, it was alright. Seemed like it was sitting there for a few hour. Nothing's wrong with that seeing I was there in 3 in the afternoon but not worthy of the 6.50 in my opinion.

Service:
You order at the counter in the front and then find a place to sit. They call your order when it's ready. Nothing special.

Decor:
Very cute and calming cafe. With board games and chess if to play if you are with your friends. 

Overall:
A more expensive cafe with great atmosphere with mediocre menu items. Had not tried the much love Sweet Potato Latte, maybe I just picked the wrong things off the menu.
author: Lilian C.

description:
A surprisingly above-average cafe in Japantown with a large selection of coffee drinks, pastries, and regular menu items. I tried the sweet potato latte, as suggested by many Yelpers, and was not disappointed. It felt like a meal in itself with the sweet potato adding a fair bit of density and heft to the whole drink. The macarons were also enjoyable, with every one of the fruitier flavors tasting like the actual fruits themselves.

This place gets a steady stream of patrons so service can be a bit rushed as it's only staffed by 2-3 people. The inside is a cozy, super-large living room with about a dozen tables for two, a larger communal table, and a small sofa / lounge chair area that can accommodate larger groups. A nice, cozy place to share coffee and dessert with a friend or two.
author: Vincent L.

description: The small old lady managing the place has horrible customer service. She screams at everyone. She treats her employees like trash.
author: Sonny S.

description: Love this cafe! It's super comfy and the tea is delicious. It's perfect for an afternoon of studying
author: Kameela A.

description: My favorite cafe in the whole world! My boyfriend and I loved their jujube and their yazu honey teas! Absolutely lovely place! The two young ladies behind the counter were very kind and helpful  :)
author: Norma P.

description:
Adorable cafe with yummy teas.

The ginger honey tea is sweet, but ginger aides in digestion so its a good combo after a filling meal in Japantown.

The music was on really low when we went to you could actually hear the person you are with which is nice. They have some games and in the middle table with the couch, they have blank books and crayons for you to show off your artistic skills. We had fun looking through what people have drawn and adding to the artwork ourselves.

I think this would be a great place for a first date (or first few dates when you're getting to know each other). Chill and cute atmosphere!
author: Emily C.

description:
It is easy to past this place in Japan town.

Once inside, the ambiance was very welcoming. I loved the set up with a lot of older stuff. Some of the display toys were of older manufacturing, such as wood horse. 

The offer some good foods and beverages. The service was fast and they were very friendly. Spacious and many tables to do things.
author: Roger A.

description:
The lattes were tasty and the ambiance was perfect. Then I tasted my chocolate mousse cake and regretted everything. It was so bitter, and I'm all about chocolate, even dark chocolate can taste delectable. But this one was just too dense I was literally just washing it down with my sweet potato latte and trying not to remember the taste. I forced my bf to finish it and even he didn't want to, that's how awful it was. 


This one super hipster cashier/server aso kinda killed it for me. He just had this 'SCREW EVERYTHING" swag about him. 

Other than that, my bf made a couple of masterpieces in their artbook, because that was the only thing that improved my impression of the place.
author: Emily T.

description:
Rude service. The cashier here is about as sharp as a marble and quite the class warrior. 
     Visit this place if your into being judge out loud by a kid with a Napoleon syndrome.
author: JD D.

description:
We came here to digest our food after a post-Korean BBQ food coma in Japantown. For a Saturday night, it was busy, but not so busy we couldn't get a seat. It has a nice atmosphere and felt very homey. Perfect for a post-dinner coffee with your friends or if you're on a date!

The table we sat at had crayons and guestbooks with blank pages. A quick glance through some of the older ones revealed that most people are pretty bad at drawing. And that a lot of people like drawing boobs on other peoples' drawings. It was actually kind of funny to leaf through all of what everyone else drew.

The drinks were really good as you'd expect from a place like this. I had a ginger honey tea, which I really liked because it wasn't so gingery as to be off-putting. Others in my group thought it was too sweet, though, and that's a common thing I've heard about all of their drinks.

Still, this is a pretty nice place within walking distance from Japantown. Check it out if you want a nice place to sit and talk with your friends or significant other (and actually hear them!).
author: Jeff H.

description:
Of all the cafes I've tried...you have NEVER failed me in any way! It's my #1 go-to place to get my nerd on whenever I want to venture away from home. I can easily get my work done here - music is not distracting (very calming), wi-fi is free, plenty of outlets, plenty of seats, staff is extremely accommodating and friendly, bathrooms are clean, lighting is perfect, food is good. 

$10 minimum for cards I believe, so it's good to carry cash for this place. I usually get hot tea or some highly caffeinated drink, along with a yogurt parfait (lots of fruit and granola) to hold me over for the hours that I plan on staying there. The croissants and macaroons are also quite tasty. Other than desserts and drinks, they also serve bagels and light sandwiches. This place can get pretty busy! But the noise level has never bothered me since people seem to be considerate of the "study/moderately social" atmosphere. 

Overall: 5. Great to come on your own or with friends to catch up and/or get some work done. Friendly staff, drink and dessert selections are plenty, atmosphere is calm and relaxing. LOVE IT!
author: Loriel L.

description: So many different varieties of tea, kind staff, and free wifi! Love the cute and quiet atmosphere here - the perfect place for after-dinner coffee or tea
author: Sarah L.

description:
Went here on a Sunday Afternoon about 5:00pm -ish. There was a festival or something going on and I barely found parking. I thought it would be noisy in the cafe or crowded in there. 

Walked in and it was mellow and relaxing. People are usually studying or reading in here and its a very refreshing ambiance. People do talk though, but it's more like a chatter rather than a full on conversation. 

The female server was very nice and friendly and laughed at me when I couldn't find the password for the WIFI when it was right in front of my face when I was asking for it. Very kind and very friendly. The male server was less friendly, but still okay for the most part. 

FOOD. I ordered the famous Sweet Potato Latte Hot Drink and some Macarons. The latte was alright, I could taste the Sweet Potato but I just wish it was sweeter for my taste. Still a very delightful treat. THE MACARONS ARE DELICIOUS. I ordered the Pistachio and Hazelnut ones. A lot better tasting than the ones you can get at CAKO. 

PRICE. $6 Minimum for Cards if you don't have any cash. I spent a total of $14 with 4 Macarons and a Sweet Potato Latte. It is a little pricey, but you do get free wifi and a quiet study place. 

Love coming here when I just want a chill ambiance to study or relax at. Wish there were more sofa's. Maybe sofa's to replace the benches near the door. Other than that, great experience here at YakiniQ Cafe.
author: Joe E.

description: Sunday morning, we left our hotel pretty early to hit up Japantown. We left a little too early cause nothing was open. YakiniQ was open at 9am when we went in, even though it says it opens at 11am on Yelp. Its a cute cafe that has little sketchbooks to draw in, games to play, and books to read. I got the jujube tea, which is a Korean date, with honey. It was really sweet. I also tried the sweet potato latte, and just like the other reviewers say, it WAS good! There's lots of seating in here too.
author: Tricia M.

description:
Cute decor and nice staff. I just had a tea, but I'll have to come back for a coffee or the sweet potato latte. Good stop to hang out for a bit and people watch in the area! 

$6 minimum for credit cards.
author: Sneha P.

description:
If you've ever walked through IKEA and thought you'd like to set up a coffee shop in one of those cozy living rooms, you'll love this little cafe.  

-  Awesome lighting, comfy chairs, spacious tables, and a  nice home-like feel.
- Free wi-fi !

On the menu: 

- Best caramel macchiatos ever.  Served in bowl cups.
- Sweet potato lattes are my gf's favorite.  I think it tastes like puree'd potato soup though.  Pass for me. 
- Shaved Ice - Takes a long time to make, excellent because they take their time slicing up fresh fruit.  GF loved it.  But I also think shaved ice is just overpriced frozen water.  Pass for me. 

Last tip: Remember you're in J-Town.  While that big Pagoda and cherry trees will put you in a state of Zen.  Be careful with leaving things in your car. I've had my windows smashed before while parking on the street here.
author: Lam N.

description:
I've only been here once.  Ordered the sweet potato latte and it was delicious!  Made of real sweet potatoes and milk and mildly sweetened.  No caffeine, which is perfect for me since I'm super caffeine sensitive at night.  

Minus one star only cuz the cashier was super rude when I asked him about one of the drinks.
author: Jenny L.

description:
A bit expensive but still good. The atmosphere is really quiet though so I'm glad I was usually on my way somewhere when I came here.

I liked the nutella hot chocolate. My boyfriend liked their ginger honey tea. He kept ordering it the three times we were there.
author: Christine D.

description:
This is definitely one of the best cafes I've ever been to. 

Situated right on the edge of Japantown, the cafe gives off that Asian modern chic yet retains a universal, artistic ambiance with really lovely decor that sets it apart from your usual coffeehouse. 

The worker is a little hard to understand in her Korean accent, but I ordered a sweet potato latte and it was quite delicious. Food (rather, desserts and snacks) can be a little expensive, but cafes aren't really the place to go for cheap quality food anyway. 

What I love most about this cafe is that it's an incredibly attractive environment to work and be productive. As someone who needs a lively yet quiet public place to force myself to do work, this is about as perfect as a cafe workhorse can be. Throw in free, moderately fast (~5Mbps) Wi-Fi and plenty of outlets and big tables and I'm in productivity heaven. 
 
In fact, I'm actually here typing away at this review, having hacked away on reviews I've neglected to write for the past month. Oh, and one more thing that makes this cafe more attractive than, say, Starbucks? It's usually open until 10pm. I am definitely in love with this place.

Note: Wi-Fi SSID is yakini2cafe and WEP key is 4154419291.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
I walked in honestly thinking I was on the set of a Korean drama.  We're doing the mandatory lovers' quarrel in a cafe scene, right?  Shit I forgot my curlers and the lip gloss that makes me all pouty BRB. 

In all honesty this is a cozy cafe with great menu options.  I could easily order the sweet potato latte all day.  Rich, creamy, and not too sweet.  Oh yes there's lots of sweet potato.  I might even have a macaroon on the side.  You are definitely here for the long term, like studying or having long conversations with the person nearby.
author: Christine L.

description: This cafe is super cute with lovely decor and seating in the spacious interior. It would be a great place to study or hang out with friends. I ordered the hot sweet potato latte and it was so warm and comforting on a cold, windy day in SF. I wanted to order a fruit tart pastry, but it was ridiculously pricey so I didn't want to take the risk of paying $4-6ish for it.
author: Sandy H.

description: TERRIBLE SERVICE. Our group made a reservation, arrived early and were asked to leave once a friend fell ill and couldn't join our party of 8. We sat and started eating then the server told us we couldn't stay at the table without 8 people. We asked if we could pay for the 8th person and they told us no.."it's the principle of it." I'm appalled that we would be seated & then asked to leave EVEN THOUGH we said we would pay for the open seat.
author: Lexi H.

description: Good coffee and banana/walnut cake. Pleasant surprise in this location. Open in the evening so good for coffee after Japanese dinner nearby.
author: Denise S.

description:
Hello from YakiniQ Cafe! I'm actually sitting here right now. After several visits here, I think it's fair to say that this is my favorite cafe in the city. In fact, I barely went back to any other cafes at all.  It's a perfect place to hang out, feeling happy and getting things done. The ambient just can't be beat. Most people come here to study, play chess, or just have a small talk, hence it's never too loud or too annoying. The staffs are always smiling and super polite. 

The bad thing about this cafe increasing popularity is that unlike a few months ago, the cafe now gets crowded really fast. On weekend morning, all of the tables may have already been occupied by 12 PM. 

So far I have tried Yuzu honey tea, white mocha, mocha, and matcha latte. I must say they are all made of quality ingredients. They serve the mocha in a bowl which is really unique--made me think of the cafe in K-drama. The matcha latte is 1000x better than the sugar loaded green tea latte at Starbucks. 

Street parkings in the residential area are free and unlimited on the weekend. On Sunday the metered parkings are also free. Bring cash, as credit cards are accepted with $10+ purchase.
author: Elle W.

description: Good macarons, cute little cafe in Japantown, but I should have passed on the matcha tea latte.....BLEH. The tea had this super fishy taste to it and I tried to get past that point hoping it would taste better but just couldn't, I threw away a half-full cup.
author: Aline D.

description:
Okay, because I'm almost always here now when I'm in the city. I will up my review because I find myself continuously magnetically drawn to this place every time I'm in town. 

I ended up trying their famous Sweet Potato latte and have to admit, it's pretty damn good. Okay, so it's kind of TOOO sweet for my liking but I'll give it one thing: IT TASTES LIKE REAL SWEET POTATO GOODNESS IN MY MOUTHHH. 

Plus the ambiance is pretty cozy. Okay fine YakiniQ, I'll admit it, you have my love, even though your lattes are still blleggghhhh. But I'll just blame it on the fact that I'm a snooty snob when it comes to coffee. 

You win, you win.
author: Vicki L.

description:
This is my go to study place. When I'm not studying here, I enjoy coming with a few girlfriends to chat and hang out. It's a very lovely place, homey and cute. I also really enjoy the music they play there. It's pretty spacious in the cafe. However, during finals and midterms time, the cafe can get quite busy and tables can become difficult to come by. I go to school at UOP Dental School and I find a lot of my schoolmates here around test times. And as this place becomes more popular, it gets more crowded. Also, recently, they blocked off the outlets on one side of the cafe. 
I've tried a lot of their menu items. My go to drink is the Iced Yuzu Honey Tea or the Yuzu Palmer. Their shaved ice is also delicious and their baked goods in the window are just as good as they look. Most of their items are reasonably priced in my opinion. $3-4 for coffee and tea and around $7 for the deserts. I'm also a big fan of their onigiri. 
Their staff is incredibly welcoming and genuinely nice. Their service is excellent. They also really try to get to know their customers and connect with them which I find very charming.
They do take credit cards, but they have a 10$ minimum charge. So I recommend bringing cash unless you're treating your friends.
They also do provide free wi-fi.
They close at 10:00 pm on the weekdays, which is perfect because it forces you to be productive while you're there and prevents all-nighters. 
I just love this place!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I love the atmosphere of this place. Good coffee and deserts, and great furniture.

Two things they need to work on:
- The internet connection is terrible, slow and constantly disconnecting.
- They blocked half the power outlets in the cafe and when I asked one of the staff I was told it was simply "The cafe owner's desire" which I thought was a rude response.
author: Omar R.

description:
I'm definitely a fan because they have parisian macaroons!!  Those are to die for, but its not like the best that i've ever tasted, but its good enough to settle my craving for one if i'm in the japan town area.  

Place is very bright, open and has decent amount of tables.  They have a selection of dessert, coffees, teas, ice cream too.  I would say good study place or meeting place.  I like the decor.
author: Noemi M.

description: I've upgraded my review one extra star because Sammy makes going to this cafe worth all four stars. She is so damn cute :-P
author: Erin T.

description:
Adorable little cafe, great place to take some work or read a book!

I thoroughly enjoyed my matcha iced green tea, it wasn't pre sweetened, just the way I like it! It's w great place to go to and wait to get called for the BBQ upstairs.
author: Michelle W.

description:
Where are the cats? YakiniQ is not complete without a menagerie of tabbys and Scottish Folds roaming around, looking for a new friend who may be a certified cat scratcher. 

Seriously, the trend began in Tokyo, moved to Seoul, so SF surely cannot be far behind. I'll pay for the kitties' airfare.

Aside from being catless, YakiniQ is still a very unique cafe. It's cutesy without being overly schmaltzy, minimal without being sterile, quiet without being a library. Someone chose the items and decor very carefully and deliberately and did so well; it's a very comfortable place that almost feels like a best friend's home. The wicker lightshades hit home for me.

They cater to the sweet tooth in all of us. Macarons (Earl Grey is delicious), Tara's ice cream, and lots of sweet coffee drinks. The sweet potato latte sounded intriguing, but doesn't have an espresso base. At the time I needed caffeine, and their americano was good and satisfied my needs.

I'll be back kitty or no kitty, or perhaps I'll bring my kitty and start the cat cafe movement here in the city. YakiniQ will be the perfect venue.
author: Joanna M.

description: The outside sign of this place confuses me as I always think YakiniQ is a BBQ place (I guess it used to be, they changed it to a cafe but they kept the sign??).  So, I always forget that this place is a cute cafe with great iced/hot drinks and bakery goods - love their fruity iced drinks!  Kids stay here and study so finding a table can be difficult at times - is there a way that a time limit can be implemented?  Otherwise, it is a good place to chat, hang out and play games (they have a bunch of puzzles, board games etc. that are communal).
author: Maile N.

description:
4.5 stars ^_^


DRINK:
1.) White Mocha = oh, YUM. Wasn't expecting anything spectacular, but this was yummy. Like a white mocha latte, a tad bit foamy ^_^ and sweet ... and in a bowl! Just like how Fei told me, real French cafes serve their lattes! 


SERVICE:
Pleasant ^_^ Closes at a decent hour, around 10pm ... Also, free wifi! Today is running just swimmingly. I appreciate somewhere reliable with outlets, bathroom on site, open decent time, and good drinks kekeke.


ATMOSPHERE:
Yup. It has the cute modern yet grandma-y furniture. Quiet conversation and relaxing classical music. Bathroom in the back and outlets ample-y dispersed about. Perfect location for my interwebbings. And I like how they keep everything spotlessly clean. No sticky mess on tables, and even behind the counter looks spic n span ~_^ Perfect place for doing work alone or to even catch up with girlfriends. Just like the 68-yr old Asian ladies chittering in Japanese or the dapper old Japanese gentlemen talking about something important ^__^ lol ruvsit.
author: Angela L.

description: Sweet potato latte? Yes. Comfy chairs? Yes. People on computers who buy one drink and stay for hours using the wi-fi? Yes. Thank heavens this space is big enough to handle all of the above. Looking forward to going back, wish I had something to study so I could chill here for hours while enhancing my neuro-connections.
author: Brian J.

description: First time visiting San Francisco and it was amazing! Stayed in little Japan town down the street from this quiet and cozy cafe. Greeted with a smile and so many delicious treats to choose from. I had their famous sweet potato latte and I almost died it was so good. Tastes like you are biting into a delicious sweet potato. Also the best Nutella macaroon I've ever had. Wish I'd stumble upon this cafe sooner in my trip. Would've enjoyed one everyday
author: Amanda L.

description:
A little japantown hangout to sip something caffinated and have a snack.

I like to relax here if I can get street parking.  Seating is usually available but I've seen it busy and full at times.

Yuzu Tea: ask for less sweet
Macaroons are yummy, do it!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Clean, spacious, cool decor set-up. I like to cafe hop the different neighborhoods in Sf and this made it as one of my favorites with their sweet potato latte. Delicious!

I've been here a couple times...never crowded and plenty of seating. Calm and laid back feel.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Bougie cafe in Pacific Heights/Japantown! What a shocker.

It looked so cute and my friend and I were drawn in by the sweet potato latte and yuzu honey tea (FYI: yuzu is a type of fruit and has a very citrus-like flavor).

I wish we would have gotten some of the delectable treats, but we were already trekking around Kabuki and knew we wanted to eat a substantial meal first. So we got the drinks and all I thought was "wow I paid $4 something for this?".

The yuzu honey tea was OK; nothing special about it. It was refreshing and did hit the spot especially since it was a rare warm day in SF. I tried my friend's sweet potato latte and almost spit it out. If you like the taste of mashed up baby food, then you will enjoy the taste of this. Why do I still remember what baby food taste like is beyond me...don't judge.

**Credit card minimum: $10, which is ridiculous since it is located in Pacific Heights
author: Surge C.

description:
Nice atmosphere and cute interior, with a good menu of drinks as well. Definitely a good café to stop by, especially if you are sick of Starbucks or Peet's. 

There are also a selection of pastries, but unfortunately I didn't have the stomach to try any. I'll be sure to try it next time I stop by though.
author: Alice C.

description: Nutella latte in a Korean coffeehouse in Japantown. What's not to love?  Adorable place.
author: Joan J.

description:
I really appreciate that this place is opened late on a Sunday night! (10pm). And just as the other reviews rave, the place is indeed very cute and clean. The place seems to attract a lot of groups, so seating seems a bit limited on a Sunday afternoon. But, if you're coming solo to work/etc, you should be able to find a seat easily. Yes. They have free wi-fi. 

I wish they had more outlets in the center area - that would be really useful! All of the outlets are against the wall..so that's where you have to be sitting if you wanna recharge your laptops.

As for the noshes - I tried their famous "sweet potato latte" and had a onigiri. The latte is a great concept - fresh pureed sweet potato with steamed milk! How nutritious! Tasty, but a bit too sweet for me. (I wonder if they add a simple syrup of some sort...if so..ask for less of it!). 

The tuna onigiri was HUGE. They stuff it with so much rice...but it's so well seasoned I gorged the whole thing :P. Very yummy with a good spicy kick to it, but it could use more avocado (since the menu claims it has avocado in it..). 

They also have a wide variety of tasty looking pastries available including cookies, french macaroons, napoleans, cupcakes, etc.

As for the crowd - as mentioned above, a lot of groups seem to come here. There are people of all ages..families..and the usual solo workers. And it's really diverse.

OH! And they have bored games :). Like Scrabble, jenga, and chess. Saw them on the back shelf. 

All in all, I'll definitely be back to try the Matcha Green Tea Latte and zone out again :).
author: Gail N.

description:
My favorite cafe in the city!
It gets really busy and challenging to get seats especially on weekends.
We came years ago when it was new and we secretly wished it would be a hidden secret!! Love this place!!
author: Alison W.

description: My friends and I ordered a Green Tea Shaved Ice for dessert on a hot afternoon. It was essentially a bunch of ice at the bottom of a handful sized cup with a scoop of green tea ice cream on top. I think there were some other stuff on it that I forgot about. There's a bit of milk as well I believe to go along with the ice? The place is actually not small when you walk inside. There's plenty of tables for everyone. There were actually people studying or just doing reading with their laptops. Overall, the shaved ice tasted sweet and surprisingly refreshing at the time of day. A good quiet place to relax with a drink in hand. It wasn't very busy on that day. I definitely will come and try some of their other awesome desserts.
author: Tony C.

description:
I want more red bean shaved ice!!

quiet and cute cafe.

free wifi and etc didnt get to use it but a lot of the people were.

good place to hang out if you want to sit and talk.

however, none of the chairs and tables matches at all. but its cute. lol
author: Carol Y.

description: Cool vibe. I got the iced mocha and it was pretty basic, but I appreciated the time and care they took in making it. They also have a nice Japanese touch to their beverages, which is pretty cool and unique. They have a nice mixture of green tea based drinks that I'm eager to try next time.
author: Bradley C.

description:
Laptop camper here. I LOVE YakiniQ the Japanese inspired coffeehouse - they have the best sweet treats: macarons, cupcakes, cookies, Tara's Organic Ice Cream (cardamom is incredible!), Mitchell's Ice Cream, shaved ice, quiche, scones, cake slices, and more. The pastries are dainty looking and I can enjoy them while using their free wi-fi.

They deserve a star for carrying Tara's Organic Ice Cream (6 flavors: http://media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/DIUfRZ5zH6oc2nm0IDLxaQ/l), the best ice cream in the Bay Area. 

* Earl grey macaron: thick, chewy, cake-like cookies with crunchy edges, thick layer of filling, nice hints of sweet lemon and tea, fabulous
* Green tea cupcake with red bean filling sesame frosting: moist cake with a few red beans inside, creamy frosting with black sesame, sesame seeds on top, loved the flavors and textures
* Latte ($3.50): served in a cute bowl with too airy foam, just okay, coffee isn't their strong suit

It's a wonderful place to bring your laptop - serene music, adorable chairs, art on the walls, free wi-fi (secure), plenty of outlets and tables, and charming hanging paper lanterns. I saw some ladies in kimonos having tea here. Their cupcake calendar is so cute. 

$10 minimum for credit cards.

You know you love me. X0 X0, laptop camper.
author: Lolia S.

description: I am not a picky person or get crazy with employees, most of the time i really don't care. I've worked at Noah's Bagel and Peets Coffee and now in hospitality. I have stopped by this cafe because i work across the street and it is pretty convenient. The few times i have visited has been an average wait for a beverage and food. The other times has been wayyyyy too long, i mean come on... 20 minute wait??? and the communication with the staff is very minimal. I wanted a bagel with cream cheese and the nice lady told me it would be a 30 min wait for it to be toasted after i paid.. another time (asked for it to be toasted) a different nice lady told me there was plain and sesame available, i choose sesame. After waiting 10 mins she hands me a cold bagel and said there was no more sesame.... well geez..... thanks for telling me!! =( at that moment i only had about 5 mins til i had to work. I've came in many times (only because it is convenient)  but i will not spend my money here anymore. it's just not worth it.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Relaxing place with coffees and such, and wifi. Sometimes I like quiet places. Yeah. Nice. Never had rude service here. Sometimes there are not enough seats.
author: Miguel L.

description:
I can't find another cafe in the city that compares to YakiniQ so I find myself here almost every weekend!

They have a nice variety of both hot and iced drinks. The dessert selection is also quite large and every dessert I've had has been really satisfying. The savory food is also totally decent. But, the thing that really makes this place is the atmosphere! It's super well maintained, cute, relaxing and the staff is really friendly.

The only thing to consider is that it is usually running at max capacity, so be ready to share a table. Also, some people (usually with ancient laptops) have a hard time because power-outlets are limited, but if you have an mbp/air you should have no problems.
author: Steven B.

description: Producing possibly the most unique cafe latte, YakiniQ Cafe claims to be the home of potato lattes. Sounds strange at first, almost as strange as its name (which it gets from the popular Korean BBQ restaurant upstairs).  It was a perfect blend of creaminess, a bit of starch, and perfect hotness. It was great. I took a careful look at the inside, people studying, and rather quiet, space is wide, and a warm and cozy decoration.
author: Dilys S.

description:
This is my absolute favorite place to be. 

Last year, I walked by this little cafe, and everything about it caught my eye. The layout, the decorations, the feel. I knew this was a place I would be spending a lot of my free time. It was love at first sight! 

While I work and still go to school, I find time to come here at least once a week. The staff are friendly and welcoming, the drinks are delicious and they have a variety of snacks and food. While it might be on the pricey side, the ambiance of the cafe wonderful. I come here to do homework all the time, and I occasionally bring a friend just to sit and chat over drinks. On any given weekend, the cafe is usually packed, and it is a little louder than usual, so if you're going to do work, remember to bring headphones. 

 Located next to Japantown mall, parking is a little difficult at times. Metered spots are everywhere, but a block up and on the opposite side of the street on Geary there is 2hour parking (free). 

Restrooms are located in the back, where you can also find a staircase leading up to YakiniQ AYCE korean BBQ. They have free wifi and a $10 minimum for credit cards. Outlets are only located on the right hand side of the cafe where there is a row of single tables. The supermarket next door is under construction thus the outlets are unavailable on the other side. 

My usual drink is a hot caramel milk tea, and if I'm hungry for a snack, a warm slice of apple pie never fails me. The turkey cranberry sandwich is light and filling while spam musubi is just the little snack to have while studying, but be careful, there is a dab of wasabi in the musubi!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Very cozy location, perfect to relax and taste delicious choices of breakfast.  Try the musubi and the shaved ice. Thumb up
author: Stefano B.

description:
(See pics)

I wish there were more cafes like YakiniQ in this neighborhood.

A very cute place with simple wooden tables and an assortment of chairs. Spacious with a few simple art pieces hanging on the walls and some paper lights hanging.

The cafe offers mainly sweets like macaroons, cakes, madeleines, cookies and a nice selection of coffees and tea.

The cappuccino is truly the authentic smaller size and not to get you too wired. I really liked the Napoleon cake as the layers were flaky and it was so rich and in big size.

A lot of people come here with the laptops and try to find the outlets and it did look popular, especially many started out occupying the whole table and then someone else comes sharing it.

We sat in the middle sofa and it's comfortable like a living room!

They also have a communal table and a few 2-people tables. A nice combination for different party sizes.

Service was fantastic and nice. Music playing here is varied and not just Japanese.
author: T L.

description:
A bit disappointing because the matcha latte and yuzi tea are just OK, and at a place like this I would expect my latte to be served in real mug not paper cup.
The matcha cheese cake is better than the latte, thanks goodness.
But it's a cute place in Japantown though, if you want a place to sit down and take  a break, this is a nice choice. But don't expect much from the menu, all the pictures on Yelp here look better than what they actually are.
author: Michele S.

description:
I absolutely LOVE this cafe.  It is very japanese styled as far as the furniture, light fixtures and everything.  The drinks they make there are different from your normal cafe which is interesting.  They have different green tea drinks as well as a sweet potato flavored latte (that I didn't try) but sounds interesting. I can't wait to try all the different drinks!  & they have ice cream too!

I love the atmosphere, you could just come bring a book or lap top and get lots of reading done!
author: Rachel N.

description:
Came here with high hopes, but was disappointed for a few reasons:

1. Sweet potato latte was just ok at best.  I got it with a shot of espresso, but it still tasted somewhat bland.  Very interesting idea, but I thought that it'd be more flavorful.

2. For a Monday at 3:30PM, I was amazed with how packed it was.  Waited a short time just to share a table and in my hour and half there, only a handful left.

3. The wifi was horrid.  I somehow couldn't connect with my phone, and when connected through my laptop, it took 10 seconds to load a small picture.  Productivity with internet related tasks is definitely not happening here.
author: Jeff N.

description:
Can we say, cutest cafe ever? Spacious, bright, "Asian"-ey, and they serve Patisserie Philippe pastries! The free wifi was acting up when I visited, so hopefully it was just that day - then you get your fifth star!

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
1 month ago, I came in and asked the gentleman at the cashier if there is any espresso in the sweet photo latte and he replied with a smarty pants attitude, "latte means milk." I don't need someone to educate me on what a latte means. I know what a latte is! since I am new to the place, I'd like to know what is in this tasty sweet potato latte which everyone talks about in yelp.

To be fair the drinks are okay but the service is horrible! I gave this place a second chance and came in again for coffee. This time around I ordered an au lait and just wanted a little more coffee because there is too much milk. (I am used to ordering from peets where their are 2/3 coffee and 1/3) and the lady again was trying to explain to me what a au  lait is. What is up with the people in this coffee house? They liked to educate customer on what the coffee drinks are as if I have never drunk any coffee in my life! I have been a coffee drinker for years and I have expectation on my coffee and apparently when I politely asked and all I got was bad respond and attitude. 

I will avoid coming to this coffee house. They need an education on what customer service really means.
author: Jessica A.

description: Great place to study and do work ! Perfect amount of lighting , great music, and great lattes. Would come here again to chill !
author: Jennie C.

description:
Very cool café and dessert spot across the street from Japantown malls
Loved their sweet potato latte.
Great sweets that include madeleines and Mexican wedding cookies
Think they have wi-fi
Friendly service
author: Rosquete B.

description:
This place is charming. The staff are super friendly. The food is good. The seating is comfortable. There is ample power. They don't rush you out like some places. All day it undulates from comfortably empty to pretty busy but is never derelict nor packed. All-in-all, I like this place a lot.

My only complaint: the wifi is inconsistent and generally slow. I was pinging about 2 Mbps at peak, more regularly around 0.8, and often lost the signal.
author: Christopher M.

description:
My most favorite cafe in the city.
Why does Japan town has all the cute cafes and why don't we have it in Nob Hill? Please, open another location :) 
YakiniQ Cafe has a very cute decor and ambiance with just the right amount of kitsch. 
This is a serene and quite place that will help you to take your mind off. ( There are occasional loud groups that ruin the moment. But what can I do, it is what it is) With Bossa Nova music in the background, this is my ideal place for bringing a book to read or studying. At other places I just don't feel comfortable enough to sit for a long time, but at YakiniQ it feels right at home. 
The treats are also very enjoyable too. For non coffee drinkers like me, there are creative and delicious options such as the caramel milk tea and Nutella latte. ( both amazing)
The shave ice has generous portion, but a little bigger scoop on the cream would not hurt.
author: Anu O.

description: Yummy yummy macaroons! I decided to get their most popular Earl Gray macaroon and I've never had one quite as exquisite as the ones from YakiniQ Cafe. The macaroons are a bit pricey $3.50 if I remember correctly, but I think they are worth it.  If I was a student, I would love studying here as there was a bunch of people there studying on a Saturday night. I didn't care so much for the tiramisu cup, but I definitely would get more macaroons! Service was pretty quick and efficient. Order your favorite cup of joe and grab a macaroon!
author: Brenda L.

description: I came here twice, and I never completed connecting the wifi. (Tried all my devices.)
author: Nakmuay K.

description:
I've only tried one thing here: the sweet potato latte, but I'd love to come back to sample more of their delicious looking/sounding items!

I'd been reading interesting reviews on Yelp about the sweet potato latte so I thought it was time I came and tried it for myself. I ordered it iced with soy milk and handed over a $5 to cover it.... kind of pricey but hey where do you ever see sweet potato latte on the menu?!

I took a seat and looked around the cafe while I was waiting for my order. The inside is super cute and cozy, I could definitely see myself tucking in to a nice cup of tea with a slice of cake and reading a good book here. It's far homier than Starbucks or any other coffee shop I've seen, and the seats appear a lot more comfortable. 

My latte was ready after a few minutes and the lady who handed it over was very nice =) I took my first sip and at first I didn't like what I ordered. I know it sounds obvious but the sweet potato flavor was very powerful and the semi-chunky texture was slightly off-putting. HOWEVER, as I continued to sip my drink I started to enjoy it more and more. Not sure why but after I overcame the initial "potato shock" the drink became quite tasty. 

I'll be returning to try their macarons, shave ice, and matcha latte soon! (^-^)
author: Sam F.

description:
Superexpensive but quite and good for studying. 
Heavy traffic and loud outside noises.

Cons
A cake is around 7~8 bucks. 
Coffee tastes ok but definitely does not worth what I pay for. 

Pros 
Sweet Potato latte is a must.
author: Jinn C.

description:
Cute cafe with plenty of tables and chairs. The place is relatively quiet, so it's a great place to get some work done. 
They also have a good variety of teas and coffee drinks. I love that they have jujube tea and shaved ice with fruits! The portion for the shaved ice was pretty big, so I would recommend sharing it with a friend. 
Will def be back here again.
author: Nancy Z.

description:
I love coming to Japantown, and this is one of the few places in this area where you can camp with your laptop.

Good:
  --- delicious light meals and desserts
  --- delicious drinks 
  --- comfortable atmosphere 

Cons:
  --- not many outlets
  --- has wifi, but not fast enough for remote log-in type of work. Web browsing OK.
  --- on popular weekends often gets crowded and won't have a seat

I've been here countless times. And never once did I have a bad experience :)
author: Elizabeth T.

description: I've been coming here on and off since it's opening. I've always enjoyed the roomy interior with various vintage collections of random items to compliment the decor of this place. Initially I really enjoyed coming here to get some studying done because atmosphere was decently quiet and facilitated studying. However as of late it has become harder to get a table to yourself because this place gets packed easily. What is worst is the incredibly slow internet, I'm talking pre-broadband,DSL in the early 2000s slow.  If you are expecting to have a high volume of customers who majority use wifi, you shouldn't be a cheapskate and opt for the cheapest internet plan. My last gripe and apparently a common one is the prices. All the snacks are even the lattes are a tad bit overpriced. The decor is the only thing this place has going for it but I can't bring myself to come here anymore if I have to put up with slow internet, poor service, and overpriced items.
author: Jude N.

description:
Cute cafe with tasty macarons, pastries, and drinks. It looked packed for a Saturday afternoon, so there wasn't really any place to sit. 

I really liked the chocolate macaron, but thought the rose was too sweet. I probably would be back to try their other flavors and pastries.
author: Vivian H.

description: Walking around Japan town and came upon this cafe. My boyfriend & I wanted coffee so we decided to give it a try. Very disappointing experience.  Nobody was in the building. We were the only ones there & it took her awhile to acknowledge us. If you're doing something, then tell us "one moment" at the least. By the time she stopped eating her banana, we ordered two regular coffees and a ham & cheese croissant (warmed up). She gave us the coffees along with the old, hard, NOT warmed up croissant. The coffees were half full & the croissant tasted like it was a week old. I kindly asked her if she could warm the croissant up & she grabbed it out of my hands, threw it in the toaster oven, and slammed it closed. My boyfriend & I were appalled. NEVER coming back.
author: Leeana B.

description: Nice atmosphere in here, but unfortunately the service is not up to stuff. They managed to somehow forget to make our order (it wasn't that busy), then we had to remind them what we ordered because they couldn't find it. I got a macaron (pretty good) and a coffee (pretty mediocre). It can be a bit tough finding a seat on weekends. Everything comes in paper cups--it would be nice to get a real mug for the coffee.
author: Ryan C.

description:
CUTE coffee shop in Japantown. 

Ordered the sweet potato latte w/ soy milk based on rave reviews and was not disappointed. I never thought to add sweet potato in my coffee.

Plenty of tables and places to sit. Good place to work or catch up with friends. They have a couch area with crayons and blank page books for kiddies to entertain themselves.
author: CL S.

description:
Ready to study with a sweet potato latte? I am! YakiniQ Cafe is a great place to write that paper that needs to be turned in by midnight or to read those textbooks that have been collecting dust. 

My favorite drink? The sweet potato latte, hot or cold! If you don't like sweet potatoes in general, probably not the best drink for you. However, there is a wide selection of common and unique drinks on the menu so try to be adventurous!

Words of wisdom: Tables are hard to get so come earlier in the day! Looking for an outlet? Only one side of the cafe has them so be prepared to do some work offline if you run out of battery juice (unless you are one of the lucky ones on the outlet side). Don't rely on the wi-fi. The noise level of this cafe fluctuates so if you are looking for a VERY quiet place, maybe look elsewhere. 

Next item on the agenda - trying that delicious-looking red bean ice dessert! ^^
author: Christine L.

description: Friendly helpful staff. Good place for Saturday morning, quiet and chilling. Good menu variety. Assorted furniture but interesting interior design. Free wifi with purchase :)
author: Tina N.

description:
TLDR:
- Nice atmosphere and unique chairs.
- Not enough outlets and often crowded.
- Bland drinks and some options are off-tasting (e.g. sweet potato latte).
- Crudely made desserts and flavors are uninteresting.
author: Christopher L.

description:
The Macaroons...
I love so much. Try every flavor even if it is a bit on the pricer end of the macaroon universe. The Green Tea and Earl Grey are by far the best of the bunch for me, and probably the best tea Macaroons I've ever had up to date. Their fruit tart wasn't too sweet which was perfect! Gah! I wish I could have tried more things, I must definitely come back some day
The Matcha Latte!!!
I loved it. Absolutely loved it. I don't know if it's my favorite...probably at a tie, but never the less an amazing cup. Hardly sweet, slightly bitter...perfection. If only I wasn't so hooked on Matcha, and I lived in SF would I ever try any other drink-I'm a big Matcha lover.
The Scene
Great ambiance. Good space. Dim but well lit. Cozy but elegant. Simple yet complex...I like it...just wish their were way more outlets and better wifi since it's a cafe and people study and what not, maybe a couch or too to lounge in and read. 
Workers
Well the cashier when I went was cute I'll give him that. XD Very quiet though, respectable, nice, and not to mention very patient. (I didn't know what to order) :)
author: Bernadette F.

description:
This review is solely for the sweet potato latte. I don't understand the hype. It's kinda like blending a boiled sweet potato and mixing it with water and simple syrup, then putting whipped cream on top. Ok, it's exactly like that. Not bad, but nothing too special.

However, the atmosphere and service is good, so I might be back to try the desserts.
author: Michael W.

description:
I LOVE this place!  I discovered it when going to the Chinese Embassy to get  Visa to visit Beijing and the wait was RIDICULOUS.  I took a number and wandered around a corner and I discovered Yakini Cafe.  This please is awesome!  I've been here 3 times and have driven to Japan town JUST for the granola!

THE GOOD:
 - fruit and granola parfait, THE GRANOLA is so nutty, crunchy and perfect
 - huge variety of baked snacks and cafe drinks
 - matcha green tea latte
 - variety of macaroons
 - service
 - ambiance is nice and peaceful

THE BAD:
 - I haven't tried everything, so I haven't found anything bad

I definitely recommend this cafe to everyone, try it out.
author: Amy P.

description: The quietest coffee shop in all of SF. So quiet that the girl who was talking on her cell phone who was sitting behind me was given "the look" from a variety of patrons. This place is clean, cute, and has tasty coffee. Didn't try any of the pastries, but they have a bunch of those, too!
author: Mel G.

description:
Was pretty excited after my friend's description of that place: spacious, yammy, not pricee, quick service, adorable atmosphere.. it made me to stop by the next day :)
That cafe is really nice! Comfortable chairs, nice smiling staff, free wi-fi (you can enjoy your friends company from all over the world/ you can study/or just serf the Net).

I took latte and a box of macaroni of all kinds for my friend (they look so tasty and fresh! it was a hard time making a decision :)): rose/passion fruit/earl grey tea and yuzu green tea - all were pretty good (according to my friend's opinion though), I tried champagne one's and they were really gooooood!

Imma be back sooon :)
author: Olga B.

description:
This place has so many varieties when it comes to dessert and drinks! I tried their sweet potato latte and it was seriously amazing. 

The whole decor and workers are so adorable. The only problem is not enough outlets and sometimes it's hard to log onto the internet because this place is always so crowded with people studying. Great place still though!
author: Dorris W.

description:
Move over Pumpkin Spice latte and make room for the Sweet Potato Latte!!

Ordered:
I came here on two different occasions

Sweet Potato Latte: I was really surprised! So yummy. I recommend adding cinnamon on top to balance the sweet potato. This is definitely an acquiring taste. The flavor of the sweet potato is not over powering at all 

Sweet Potato Latte with a shot of espresso: If you don't want a strong sweet potato flavor, I think the espresso is a good option. It also cuts down on the sweetness. Although $4.35 for this drink is a bit expensive. I cried a little when I paid. 

Overall Experience:

This is a cute coffee shop snuggled in Japantown. The decor is incredibly simple and chic. From the nice sofa to the mix match chairs, this coffee place is a great place to meet friends or study.
author: Thoa H.

description:
Cute, comfortable; yet, crowded.

All the C words that come to mind with my review of YakinQ cafe.  They are known for their Sweet Potato Latte (too sweet for me) and their assortment of pastries and ice cream.

Also, it seems to be the popular place to be to study, work, catch up on reading or catch up with a significant other.

The service is friendly enough, the space is good to relax and to get your business done.   Yet, beware...depending upon the time when you arrive, all available seating and/or table space may be taken and it may take a while to receive your espresso drink!

Also, word to the wise...for credit/debit card usage, you must purchase above $10 worth of goodies.  

A cup o' joe runs about $2, the salads around $9, the other espresso drinks around $4 ish.

Metered parking nearby, street parking is hit/miss and there is always the Japantown parking garages across the street.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
This is just the perfect environment to get my work done. Quiet, cozy, and with yummy sweets. If Anthropologie had a cafe, this is how I would imagine it to look.

The coffee isn't anything spectacular, and I think the sweet potato latte is more of a dessert than anything else, but it's the perfect environment. Not too many tables so they may run out, and yes, the outlets are few and far, but strategize your visits and it shouldn't be too much of a hassle.
author: Vi N.

description:
This place is lovely. I'm sure I'm not the only one who enjoys the sweet potato latte because it seems to be their signature drink. The rest of the menu is also delicious as far as I can tell, but I have yet to taste everything. I would only have to complain about the artwork on the walls. Although it is not the poor quality usually found in cafes, it is pretty bad. I guess the colors are ok because they utilize white very prominently which makes them fall back into the wall. 
The atmosphere here is also good as the music is chill and played on a cool retro record player. The clientele is not too loud apart from the occasional entitled yuppie who stumbles in from neighboring pacific heights.
author: LaMouche M.

description:
I would've given this place 4 stars, but their wifi is very off and on. This is a very cozy place to study. I think I overheard one of the cashiers say that it's only been open for 3 weeks. I had the blueberry mint ice cream (from Tara's Organic Ice Cream) and it was delicious! I thought it was pricey when the boyfriend ordered it since I think it was $3.95, but when it was brought to our table, I suddenly understood why it cost so much--because it was about 3 scoops full of ice cream. The boyfriend ordered an iced matcha. It was very milky and would have been better if it were sweetened.

There are quite a number of tables here and it doesn't get too crowded (but it might be because they just opened not too long ago). It's nice and quiet, and the music they play is very soothing. I would definitely here to study again, but only if I had to do work that does not require the internet.
author: Lily Z.

description:
Very cute and a great place to study, work, or just enjoy a conversation with a friend over macarons and flower tea. 

They have pretty good spam musubi as well. 

Definitely recommend.
author: Sara M.

description: My friend and I decided to satisfy our sweet tooth here and ordered some macarons along with a sweet potato latte for him and a nutella latte for myself.  I'm a huge fan of anything with nutella so I thought the latte was great. The decor of this spot is really cute & cozy which definitely attracts people who want to go and study. It's definitely not a spot to bring a big loud group of friends.
author: MissChelle C.

description: Nastiest macaroons I had ever tried! I just felt like I ate few bottles of  perfumes X_X but love their decoration tho
author: Shelly H.

description:
Love coffee shops. Love Japanese culture. Absolutely loved this place. 

Made me wish I had something like this in my neighborhood back in NYC.
author: Alesandro R.

description:
i had a macha latte, it was good! wish they could do some fancy "drawings" on the drink ahah. it would have made my day.
the dessert look delicious but i didnt have the stomach for it since i went after dinner.
i'd love to try next time i visit!
author: Ru C.

description: Super charming spot! Their yuzu honey tea is delicious! The counter people are very friendly and courteous. There are purchasable arts on the wall. Games all the way in the back shelf. Will definitely come back!
author: Sunny C.

description:
A terrible place to go! These guys have no clue how to manage, serve and provide basics to customers!!!!
I ordered sweet potato latte and it taste horrible and the drinks are expensive and came out messy. If you want to waste money, go to this place. The drink was only half way filled in the cup and tasted dull so I asked if the drinks are suppose to have no taste and the lady responded very rudely to put sugar in my drink. 
I am never going back to this cafe and customers should not be treated like this
author: SN K.

description:
Food and drink: Expensive and delicious. Be aware that some drinks come in very tiny cups.

Atmosphere: Great for studying. I usually listen to Japanese radio while I study, so the soft conversational Japanese that goes on there keeps me rolling. The vinyl records are nice too, though I feel bad that the baristas have to stop every 5 minutes to change them. The art is okay I guess. The lighting is nice. Free wifi is always a plus.

Prices: If you don't wear Burberry and Coach like most people wear Hanes, prepare to sell a kidney to feed your addiction to this place.
author: Sterling D.

description: The cafe is very cute and cozy. I ordered their macha latte which is very tasty. The only reason for this 1 star rating is due to their horrible customer service. The cashier that took my order was very rude. She seemd very impatient to answer my simple question about the sweetness level of my drink. Didn't catch the cashier's name, but she has short hair, and was wearing black frame glasses. Also, WiFi here is too slow to even surf the web.
author: J T.

description:
I love this place. Their sweet potato latte is to die for! Prices are average. GREAT environment to study in as most everyone there is also studying. It's small, yet well lit and isn't cramped. Can be difficult to find a place to sit as it does get busy later in the day. 

I wish it opened earlier then 11am. I believe they open early now that it's October...

I love how friendly everyone who works there is. Everything's always clean too. They keep up the cleanliness of the bathrooms real well. Also as soon as someone leaves, someone rushes right over to clear any dishes left and wipe down the table. 

Only problem I have with this place is the fact that they have only 3(?) outlets in the entire place. Only the smalls tables on the right hand side of the place have outlets. The ones on the other side are all taped up. Although this is my number one place to study/work, I've had to walk in and turn around and leave, as I need an outlet for my computer and all the tables are full. 

But I still highly recommend and always try to go here first before leaving.
author: Megan L.

description:
What a cute cafe! The ambiance is adorable and it has nice modern touches. I went there with a friend on a Thursday night it all the seats were taken by people diligently studying and playing board games.

 I ordered bread pudding and my friend got shaved ice. The bread pudding was overpriced in my opinion (almost $7). I've had better for a less expensive price. However, I did like it but not as much as my friend's shaved ice. The shaved ice was on point! It wasn't too sweet and the flavor combination was excellent. And, the shaved ice was quite big; therefore, it was well worth the reasonable price.

If I lived closer to Japantown I would probably stop by again. They have a lot of tasty looking desserts, which are rather tempting. If you are looking for a sweet treat and a place to study or chill check this cafe out. 

3.5 stars!
author: Abena O.

description:
I've been here twice.  The first time I was here I loved it so much I told all my friends they had to try the sweet potato latte here.  And the girls who worked the counter were so cute and made my drink so perfect.  They really do use real sweet potato, and it's so hearty.

Second time:  I had a super rude cashier.  Dunno what happened but this time around instead of two Japanese girls helping me, there were two hipsters who appeared to not be doing anything.  Cashier was some tall white boy who gave me an attitude when I paid him the total.  He didn't even mention the total plus tax, but when I handed him the total without tax all he said was "There's tax."  And i was like "what's the new total?"  And he seemed pissed.  I dont' know how they found this loser, or how he ended up getting a job here.  Unfortunately he also made our drinks, and like his cashiering skills, the drinks were totally half assed.  I brought my sister here and both our sweet potato lattes tasted different from each others.  He barely put anything in there, it just tasted like sweet milk.  Sorely disappointed.  Won't be coming back.
author: Biqi C.

description:
I've been looking for a nice quiet cafe to hang out in, that also puts effort into their pastries. My roommate recommended YakiniQ, so I visited this morning. I was very impressed by the service, the spaciousness, and the food! I had a hard time choosing my pastry because everything looked so delicious, but I settled on Evelyn's Cake -- buttery pound cake dusted with chocolate and filled with candied walnuts. Yummy and just sweet enough for me, but the powdered chocolate was a bit messy and I got some on the table, my laptop, etc. :( I really liked my hazelnut latte, which came in a nice heavy bowl. 

I recommend coming in the morning around 10-11AM when it's pretty empty so you can snag one of the 2-3 outlets (wish there were more!). In the afternoon it quickly filled up. I'll definitely be stopping by again, as I had my eye on their macarons, matcha latte, and croissants :)
author: Stephanie P.

description:
First time here,

The shaved ice is a horrible idea, ice + ice cream? That is like a hat over a hat. 5 minutes out and the whole cup starts melting down, ice cream mixing up with the water from the ice, totally disgusting. The macaroons have been there for a while so they were very chewy. Also, I did not taste any mint in my iced mint mocha. I love the settings and the background thou.
author: Bao T.

description: Such a cute little coffee and tea place! The most delicious macarons I have ever had!!
author: Kelly T.

description: This place has a great atmosphere. Tables for laptops and conversation with a group of people or just a date kind of thing. The desserts look and taste great! I had the tiramisu that comes in a cute jar. I also had a strawberry lemonade infused honey... So refreshing and tasty! My only complaint? The price. I spent $7 something on the tiramisu (most I have ever spent) and $5 on a glass of lemonade (no free refills with that price) in all I spent $12! Way to pricey for SF. But hey if money isn't an option, I def recommend this place.
author: Charlie D.

description: Great macaroons and simple hot tea. Passion fruit macaroon rules.  Great selection of teas and coffee beverages to choose from.
author: Brian B.

description:
I LOVE coming here to do work. The atmosphere is so nice, the music is great and at a nice level where if I decide to listen to my own stuff, I don't have to blast my earphones. The coffee is delicious. Haven't tried the food yet but from what I've seen, it looks amazing. They also have a sweet potato latte that I'm nervous about trying but who knows...maybe one day I'll get around to it. What an interesting concept. 

The only downside to this place is there are outlets on only one wall. So unless you get lucky to get one of the tables on that side, make sure your laptop is fully charged before you go in!
author: Laura A.

description:
YakiniQ always gets filled up pretty quickly, especially during weekends when everyone's trying to cram or get some work done. It doesn't stop people from pouring in though - the atmosphere is great. Tables are big and spacious to spread out your study materials and food/coffee, the lights are bright enough so you can concentrate. 

The food is a bit on the pricey side - 10 bucks for a mediocre sandwich. But the drinks are great - I'm really impressed by their tea selection as well as their sweet potato latte - signature drink. 

I wish their wireless signal is a bit more robust - on a busy day I can hardly connect to their wifi.
author: Nancy L.

description: This place is so horrible both in terms of drinks and service! Me and a group of friends came here to grab a drink during the cherry blossom festival, since we noticed it wasn't too crowded. I ordered a strawberry yuzu palmer and my bf ordered a root beer float. My drink was not even cold and extremely warm. YUCK! It was so difficult to finish everything. The old asian woman who was the cashier rudely told my bf to hold on in the middle of taking his order. His drink was awful as well! Never again!
author: Kimberly M.

description:
Came in here for the Edible Excursions for Japantown. 
We were served the Sweet Potato Latte. What the heck?!! Who would have thought that Sweet Potato should be in a latte. It was soooooooo gooooooooooood. 
That's the ultimate comfort drink on a cool winter night. 
I'll be dreaming of it until I return one day!
author: Lenalour L.

description:
I'm in constant search of the perfect shaved ice, though I haven't found it yet in San Francisco.
However, this place is not bad for shaved ice, the green tea shaved ice was good enough for me to go back. They do win in terms of ambiance and selections of other drinks, and pretty tasty macarons too. There aren't any places that I know that serves sweet potato latte in SF except here, so no qualms there.
author: Yi Y.

description: Cute little cafe with great pastries, love the chocolate macarons, and interesting and delicious drinks like Yuzu Tea. Unfortunately, on Saturday there were no seats left, perhaps it's a good place to work on the weekdays.
author: Jess C.

description:
it is soooo cute here i love everything about the place! milk tea, macarons, ice cream, and so much more! it gets busy here: students with their laptops...

i only wish the closed later like midnight instead of 10pm.
author: Rosalee C.

description:
I used to go here every week, (sometimes everyday!!) when they first opened. I am not going to lie. I brought alot of my friends here. The service was great, even though the coffee and drinks really suck and little pricey.

Don't go here for coffee, but for me, go here for the service & quiet, clean ambience.

WHOLE SHIT changed now.
It is not only crowded but also....

The service? -- NOT GOOD. The fake blonde hair guy works there is totally rude. Did you not learn how to act like a gentleman when you grew up? wheres the manners? telling customers to change the table (when other customers are completely fine with it), glaring them when they dont order anything for more than 3 min. I wanted to settle the shit down before i ordered something. YEs we ordered 2 drinks with 3 people...mm... so? I do not want to come here anymore.

COFFEE? not good. really watered down, and tastes like cheap ass coffee you would get from the gas station + water + water +Water. The amount that they gave you is very small for the price. 

FYI!!!! 
WIFI? Dont even bother to ask for wifi password before you order something. they give you shit for it. :)
author: Berry P.

description:
One of my favorite cafes in the area - yuzu tea, matcha latte, etc :)

It's super popular though, so if you're intending to study or get work done, and need a seat, highly recommend getting there early.

1 star off for limited number of plugs! (there are probably like 3 total outlets in the entire cafe!!!)
author: Food E.

description: Great place to work - so spacious with quirky cool decor. The drinks and cookies are delicious too!
author: Sarah G.

description: This is a very lovely cafe. It's very inviting and open - has a lot of seats for customers and a bookshelf. There are a variety of sweets and beverages. The macarons are very good and the sweet potato latte looks amazing! Can't wait to come here on a day off to read and relax.
author: Sherry L.

description:
Who's bright idea was it to serve coffee in a bowl? Because that's how this cafe serves you your latte - in a porcelain bowl with no grips or handles to handle your beverage. So when you inevitably slip grabbing your hot cup of joe and it ends up on your lap and phone, you too can sit there and wonder "Who the f*ck serves coffee in a bowl?" 

Also the tiny old Asian lady at the front counter was not friendly. But that's probably because she keeps having to clean up spilled coffee.
author: C. d.

description:
Love this place!

I really was reluctant to yelp about this spot just because I wish I could keep this gem all to myself but its just too great, I had to brag about it!

When you walk into this place, one might find one person having a study session, or typing a paper on their lab top, or enjoying a sweet potato latte, or meeting up with friends, and/or having a first date. Whatever the reason, YakiniQ provides a place where many people agree on going to.

For myself, I have a couple of reasons why I go. I really like the menu they offer; from the sweet potato latte to caramel latte to passion macaroons to the spam masubi-all delicious (I have yet to try their shaved ice). I also think the staff are super friendly and helpful- always smiling and cleaning up the spot when needed. YakiniQ is also decorated so cute- it has mismatching pieces, which makes it feel like your in someone else's home but not being cluttered or anything but more eclectic! I adore it! The cafe  easily offers a study space with their spacious seating, lounge area, large communal table, and a good amount of outlets for all you techies out there. 

Please do yourself a favor, try this spot if your ever in need for a new, refreshing, innovative space but please, please save me a spot!
author: C M.

description:
Very unique and very popular drink here! The sweet potato latte made with real sweet potatoes!

I decided to order this while waiting for some friends for dinner. It came out to be $3.80 something for a small cup to go. Very interesting to have a latte really taste like sweet potatoes! My bf didn't know what I ordered and so when he took a sip and said "whoa what is this?!" 

There is tiny chunks of sweet potatoes in this drink, so don't be afraid to chew the tiny pieces! I found it refreshing. It reminded me of the winter time when my mom would bake bake whole sweet potatoes for us to eat.
author: Erica T.

description: The cafe itself is fine. But I was really disappointed when my bill was $5.98. The credit card limit was $6.... And they wouldn't charge it for me unless I bought something else. Really.....? :( cute place. A bit too quiet for me though since it felt weird being the only ones talking.
author: Leanna J.

description:
I was a bit disoriented by the staggering breadth of variety offered by Yakini's menu..  So naturally, my eyes were guided towards a colorful cascade of poofy, yet savory Macaroons (raspberry, hazelnut, lemon, green-tea, almond) -I think the nuttier ones were the best.. The fruity ones were a bit too rich, these aren't as delicate as other places I've tried for Macaroons but for an Asian equivalent I am pretty impressed.

My iced green tea latte (with no additional sugar) was the perfect drink to compliment the sweets.  I was also thankful that they didn't turn me away for ordering an iced drink since they were 10 minutes til' closing (I know.. -I'm sorry!!), like they did the guest who came in immediately after me..
author: Ty T.

description: Quiet and cozy Asian cafe in Japantown! Interesting artwork, many small tables along the walls, agreeable music, and comfy couches near the middle. Tried their famous sweet potato latte. It was pretty yummy: thick consistency, not overly sweet, and in a pretty big mug. Finding bits of the puréed sweet potato at the bottom was a genuine surprise! I had to finish it in a hurry since my friend and I had to catch a movie down the street in 10 minutes. Gotta say I loved it! All in all a great place to study, catch up with friends, or read/relax for some alone time. Free Wi-Fi and there are games at the back e.g. Jenga and Scrabble! I will be back to try some macaroons, cakes, and flavored lattes!
author: Andy C.

description:
A café that allows u to just really relax yet feel studious, catch up on your reading, surf the internet (w/free wi-fi btw) while fulfilling your sweet indulgences & caffeine needs.  That's what a café should embody yes?

They have a great selection of desserts & drinks that not only taste cute but indeed look cute as well. Yes. Taste cute. The ambience is actually quite cute in itself but not overbearingly cute with their assortment of lanterns & not a single chair in the room is the same at a table. Unique.  Their art on the walls r great on the eyes as well. 

The staff is excellent & fun...one night my fiance & i made a visit & they closed the cafe with a 7-min joke session. They asked the customers to reply to their comedic questions & whoever replied to the joke correctly won cookies! How awesome is that? ^_^ 

Anyhoo...enough of my dragging review. YakiniQ is a wonderful café experience. I highly recommend it. Check it out when u can next time you're in J-town!

p.s.
Don't leave without trying a Nutella Latte, Jujube Tea & fruit tart.  My personal favorites.
author: Micha M.

description:
This place has a GREAT ambience in a very vibrant part of downtown. People of all backgrounds seem to come chill here. Being my first time, I had to try out the Sweet Potato Latte. No foam art for me, but the drink is unique, espresso-less, and delicious. Strands of sweet potato make the drink feel very homemade. Not too sweet, either, which is great.

13 tables, a couple couches, board games, books, and sweet decor have won me over. 

The wifi is slow, though. =( 

Note: No cards for a less than $10 purchase!
author: Kenny Z.

description: Sweet place. Plenty spacious. Tried their sweet potato latte (with soy) and ginger honey tea which weren't that impressive. Enjoyed the ambiance of the place more than their drinks.
author: Anji S.

description: This is my favorite place to work on my laptop.  The space itself is large with many tables, so you're not crammed in next to other people or feeling pressured to hurry up.  It's very inviting, and their sweet potato latte is AWESOME.  They also serve food and desserts.
author: ABBY D.

description:
Lately, this has been my go-to place to get some work done. 
While the lighting is a bit dim in some areas and there are limited outlets, I really like this place for the cute decor and the yummy drinks.

The idea of trying a sweet potato latte may sound a bit strange but trust me.. It's goooooood. The sweet potato pieces really add to the natural sweetness of the drink. 

Their tuna onigiri is  surprisingly filling. It's kind of nice to see how it's arranged with the avocado on top, which makes it look pretty fancy. However, after  a few bites, everything just gets messy..but it could just be me and my messy eating habits. harharhar. 


One thing to note is that they only accept card with purchases over $10 and that it can be a bit difficult to get the seat you want, especially if you're coming in a big group.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I really like this place for no particular reason at all really...

I've just recently moved to san francisco, and have been looking for a nice place to get coffee.
 i've checked out a lot of places in nopa and western addition, and while this is definitely isn't the BEST place to get coffee, it is still PRETTY DAMN GOOD....

but i've also been on a tea craze lately, and since I've found very little tea culture here (maybe i'm mistaken) this is place is so great because you've got your variety of teas, coffee, desserts, lunch/snacks, and pastries all in one place, so it's really nice to study in, cause you can sit down around 12, stay for 6 hours of so, get work done, and never get bored of the menu.

The food itself is alright, pretty good and filling, good portions.
i really like the onigiri, only sometimes i've found that the stuffing/rice ratio is off (being wayyy too much rice instead of tuna) but other than that, the rice is good quality and it's very satisfying (only eat this stuff when ur starving tho, it's starving man's food)

I like the caprese a lot, but i'll eat anything with mozzarella and tomatoes, the bahn mi (mee) is OK, not great, I love the caramel milk tea and latte

the matcha latte is alright, not as good as Asha's in berkeley

all the drinks are a bit on the sweet side (as most cafes in asia make them) so have that in mind

my review probably is still a bit skewed, but this is just my account of what i've tried so far...


can't really name a definite reason why i gave it 5 stars. but i've been coming here 2-3 times a week, so I guess there must be something

EDIT (20 seconds later): I forgot to mention that the connection here is pretty bad. Sometimes it's very decent, but at other times it's impossible to watch videos and takes a least 10-20 seconds to load a page (such as wikipedia or something) so keep that in mind if you're here to study using the internet...

oh yeah, and if you're someone who likes to study in silence (probably not though if you're coming to a cafe to study) this is probably not for you...
while most of the time, the chatter is kept to a good level where it all blends in the background, occasionally there will be a rowdy group of kids or ahjumas chattering verrryyyyyyy loudly...
author: Jessica S.

description:
This place has such a chic and chill atmosphere. The dessert selection is amazing! I had the tiramisu which was so yummy. It's cute too! Comes in a small
Jar. And I had the iced strawberry lemon effused honey tea. Delicious and refreshing. My only complaint was the price. Tiramisu for a little jar for over $7 bucks? And two iced teas, I spent $18 all together!!!! Really pricey.
author: MC W.

description:
A really cute asian cafe.. my friend thought it was a hello kitty store from the outside looking in, lol! 

PROS
     -great place to study - FREE WI-FI
    - many small tables and a big table
    - plenty of outlets and lighting
    - good service 
    - clean bathroom 
    - good teas and coffees with a large variety of sweets (cookies, cakes, tarts, organic ice cream, Korean shaved ice, and delicious MACARONS) and savory snacks (salads and unique sandwiches) 
    - free iced water
    - cute chairs (all different kinds) and even comfty couches if needed
    - good music, not too loud (that annoys me sometimes cause i wouldn't be able to concentrate) 

CONS
    - sometimes hard to get a table because it gets so crowded! 
    - not a lot of comfy seating for groups to talk and chill (there are more chairs and tables for studying)
    - minimum of $10 for credit card
    - sometimes hard to find parking in Japantown 

Reminds me of a cafe back home in Chicago called Outdoor Cafe, but better =]
author: Lily S.

description:
Been here several time to study and relax. Nice decor,music and also free wifi. I love the macaroon is sooo good and the sweet potato latte :) 

Here come the problems...If you plan to use laptop all the time while you at here, please bare in mind. They used to have reasonable wall plug but now, they took off all the plug only left TWO plug in their whole cafe. Seriously? It is funny seeing other customer asking "hey, do you mind we sharing the plug thank you." lol think twice before you plan to come here for spending more time than your laptop can provide ;) 

p/s: iPad should be fine 10hours battery life :D
author: Zhe C.

description: Okay that lady saw me go through the door and did not greet me. Fine okay it's the morning. But a latte for almost five bucks is too much. Lastly the lady made my latte and it was not filled up.
author: Karen J.

description:
Croissants from Patisserie Philippe (the best in SF), good coffee, kind people, pretty decor. 
Typical Japanese/Korean cafe with a hint of San Francisco style, it's ladylike and cute, exactly the right place to meet a darling friend, or for a late afternoon lunch with the hubby, or a fun breakfast with a little boy. I did all this and it was lovely. Than you YakiniQ!



(People who complain about the price are the ones who expect gold the price of copper)
author: Del D.
